Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 717b9802fad291b07dfb870a3502846f54298a82
Validator?
Done
For here and everywhere else, shall be handle path failures here?
+1.  Also, if we're chaging this, it should be using urlFromPieces.

It is changed to urlFromPieces in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/54548/ Also this patchset

And the path failure will be handled in getCertificateProperties() when calling DBus.
This is called several time, consider getting this as a string, and use it twice?
Done
What's the convention here? I saw we construct this |object_path| just for contacting a path? Does it worth it?

unfortunately we're inconsistent on dbus between our usage of object_path and string.  Also, object_path doesn't have a constexpr constructor, so there's no way to make ldapObjectPath constexpr, so this is what we have for the moment.  If someone wanted to, they could come up with a patches with the mods to sdbusplus::message::object_path to allow it to be constexpr (or maybe a constexpr specific type)


For the moment, I think this is the best we have.
Agreed

> I can actually asking this:
> 
> ```
> std::string certURL =
>             "/redfish/v1/AccountService/LDAP/Certificates/" + id;
> sdbusplus::message::object_path path(certs::ldapObjectPath);
> path /= id;
> ```
> 
> There are two styles of contacting paths ("${a}/" + b, vs using sdbusplus) in the same code. Should we use the same way? 

These are two different paths, one is a url, one is a dbus object path.  There are minor differences in how we use them.  Yes, ideally everything should be using sdbusplus these days, but it didn't always exist, so there's a lot of code that does the string concat on its own.

> 
> Why is it related to constexpr constructor of object_path?

Because ideally we'd be able to do

constexpr sdbusplus::message::object_path ldapObjectPath = "...";

and avoid the intermediate object_path construction that you mentioned entirely.

> constexpr sdbusplus::message::object_path ldapObjectPath = "...";

I see. You want to declare the global variable constexpr. Makes sense.
Ack

Given that we don't use the intermediate |path| directly, can we do

```
std::string path = sdbusplus::message::object_path(certs::httpsObjectPath) / id;
```

which saves a line of code?
Done

Considering the above is 81 characters before preceeding whitespace, it doesn't seem like it would save a line of code, as we'd have to wrap at character 80.

Up to you if this is something you'd like to see though.
I think it's more clear to use current `std::string objPath =  sdbusplus::message::object_path(certs::ldapObjectPath) / id;`. Keep current patch.
Fine either way, just pointing out that it doesn't save a line if we have to wrap.
